intro: Andryala ragusina var. incana, commonly known as the Sicilian ragusina, is a rare and endemic plant species native to southern Italy. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or calcareous soils and thrives in Mediterranean climates. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in umbels, and it produces small, oval fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
